content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the "execute_python_code" command to calculate the area of a circle with a radius of 5. When I used the "google" command, I received a list of articles on the legal implications of using artificial intelligence in the workplace. In addition, I used the "list_files" command and received a list of files in the current directory, including "circle_area.py" which was likely used to calculate the circle area.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "read_file", "args": {"filename": "legal_research_resources.txt"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command read_file returned: Notes on Legal Research Resources:\n\n- Harvard Law School Library guide on free legal research: https://guides.library.harvard.edu/law/free\n- Texas State Law Library guide on legal research for beginners: https://guides.sll.texas.gov/legal-research-for-beginners\n- George Mason University Law Library list of free legal research resources: https://www.law.gmu.edu/library/freelegalresearch\n- Bloomberg Law's Complete Legal Research Resource: https://pro.bloomberglaw.com/the-complete-legal-research-resource/\n- Clio's list of best free legal research tools: https://www.clio.com/blog/best-free-legal-research-tools/\n- Alaska Court System's legal research page: https://courts.alaska.gov/library/aklegal.htm\n- United Nations' legal research guide: https://research.un.org/en/legal\n- LexisNexis's list of best free legal research tools: https://www.lexisnexis.com/community/insights/legal/b/thought-leadership/posts/best-free-legal-research-tools", type='action_result')]
"""
